name: benzene, 1,4-bis(bromomethyl)-
Reason: The basic unit benzene has a melting point of 5.5°C. The presence of each bromomethyl group contributes to raising the melting point due to increased molecular weight, polarity, and potential for intermolecular interactions such as dipole-dipole forces and possible halogen bonding. A bromomethyl group contains a bromine atom which significantly increases the molecular weight and polarizability compared to a methyl group. This addition typically raises the melting point by approximately 70°C per bromomethyl group. There are two bromomethyl groups attached to the benzene ring which overall increases the melting point significantly.
